data.text: 🔴 LIVE NOW: Press Conference on the Regional Economic Outlook for The Americas, with Nigel Chalk, Acting Director of the IMF’s Western Hemisphere Department. #IMFAmericas https://t.co/YDVdOAskm8

.@GitaGopinath: Getting to 40% vaccine coverage globally by the end of 2021 is still possible but requires a big push now. #DataforAction 

📺 Watch A Roadmap to End the COVID-19 Pandemic seminar. https://t.co/KnivhkTPG5 https://t.co/67AzHQmJc1

Surging energy prices will likely return to more normal levels early in 2022 when heating demand ebbs and supplies adjust. But if prices stay as high as they have been, it could be a drag on global growth. More in our latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/AYqODLkmXi https://t.co/oybQeGq6qh

📰Last week we published the World Economic Outlook. Today, Nigel Chalk presents the regional outlook for Latin America and the Caribbean. 

👍 Follow the live presentation at 1:00 p.m. ET! https://t.co/p00hyZg1xZ #IMFAmericas https://t.co/6Oo7IK21HI

Rising food prices in sub-Saharan Africa are eroding household income, threatening food security and adding to the risk of social tension and political instability. More in our latest outlook: https://t.co/nPhQ7iy9BU #IMFAfrica https://t.co/3PHGmMhl5C

[DOWNLOAD] The latest Regional Economic Outlook for sub-Saharan Africa discusses why vaccines are vital to the region’s recovery and prospects. Download the report here: https://t.co/nPhQ7iy9BU #IMFAfrica https://t.co/3xWcaNyeYn

🆕 Sub-Saharan Africa’s economy will grow by 3.7% in 2021. This is lower than the rest of the world, contributing to the global divergence between countries with access to vaccines and those without. Read our latest analysis. https://t.co/nPhQ7iPL0u #IMFAfrica https://t.co/s6NdPx1JpB
🔴 LIVE: IMF’s @Aselassie presents the latest analysis and growth projections for sub-Saharan Africa. Read and download the report here: https://t.co/nPhQ7iPL0u #IMFAfrica https://t.co/98oXfgSBXD

The pandemic had a serious impact on the European labor market. The wholesale and retail sectors were hit the hardest, while communications technologies helped mitigate the recession by allowing remote work. Watch the full European REO discussion: https://t.co/nXToTPC02q https://t.co/SvfAph0BVM

Many developing countries struggle to convert vaccine contracts to actual deliveries, making it difficult to vaccinate 40% of the population by the end of 2021. 

@Ruchir_Agar outlines how to make that happen and end the pandemic. ➡️ https://t.co/Knivhlbr4F https://t.co/h94s3qvJLF

.@KGeorgieva: #DigitalMoney brings both opportunities, but also risks, for the global economy. 

📺 Watch the seminar to hear more on both 👉 https://t.co/4GgWv5n88l https://t.co/fbxYU5fNoN

TOMORROW, Thursday, October 21, at 7:00 AM ET (1:00 PM CAT): Join us for a live press briefing with @ASelassie, Director of the African Department, on the economic outlook for sub-Saharan Africa. Watch here: https://t.co/nPhQ7iPL0u #IMFAfrica https://t.co/98oXfgSBXD

Watch now: our last #IMFCapDev event at the #IMFMeetings discusses how countries can raise additional revenues, including by enhancing tax systems and modernizing public financial management, to resume their progress toward meeting the Sustainable Development Goals. https://t.co/9oYqxReBQr

JUST RELEASED: In our new Regional Economic Outlook for Europe, we project 5.2% growth for advanced economies, as well as 6% for emerging market economies in 2021. Learn more here: https://t.co/BBgmmaVYXq https://t.co/ef7xEd4sOd

NEW: Check out a conversation on the state of the recovery in Europe. The IMF’s Alfred Kammer discusses the latest economic challenges that are emerging, as well as the policies that can help the region secure a stronger, fairer recovery: https://t.co/BBgmmaVYXq https://t.co/UdfWRUGDXq
LIVE NOW: Alfred Kammer discusses the IMF’s new economic outlook for Europe in a press conference. https://t.co/ZVfyjcJdkS

A faster-than-anticipated normalization in US monetary policy could weaken economic activity and increase downside risks to growth in many Asian economies, especially emerging markets. Learn more in the latest regional outlook report: https://t.co/FkepWlGDSQ https://t.co/P2UFxL67UH

Although GDP is expected to recover in advanced economies, it will remain lower than expected before the pandemic elsewhere, and revenues will also suffer. Learn more: https://t.co/4yV6zr7at9 https://t.co/ilWrvhjvTD

.@KGeorgieva: Overcoming the digital divide and weak institutions are vital so we all can take advantage of the opportunities of #DigitalMoney. 📺 Watch the Digital Money Revolution seminar➡️ https://t.co/4GgWv5n88l https://t.co/OROk76fuXm
Join Chief Economist @GitaGopinath for a high-level panel on net-zero policies and finance on October 20, at 11:20 AM ET. https://t.co/RWg6t1hV9q #COP26 https://t.co/lMgD6TwfIg
Why is fiscal credibility so important? The IMF’s Vitor Gaspar, Director of the Fiscal Affairs Department explains. Learn more: https://t.co/4yV6zroLRJ https://t.co/5MSe1ccnZH
IMF Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh on priorities to support food security in sub-Saharan Africa. https://t.co/Lek6D17b0z https://t.co/jcUDKwxRW2
🆕 #AsiaPacific Regional Economic Outlook - Navigating Waves of New Variants: Pandemic Resurgence Slows the Recovery. Read the full report here: https://t.co/bHtUMs3QyG https://t.co/Vq6Gufn2Wh
🔴 LIVE: IMF’s @KGeorgieva and @BIS_org’s Agustín Carstens discuss the role of #fintech in enabling financial inclusion. https://t.co/xx3s25TUf4 #DCFintechWeek2021
📢 STARTING NOW: The latest economic forecast for the #AsiaPacific region. Watch the live press conference here. https://t.co/ZCCJz1CKFb

What is the IMF’s economic outlook for Europe? Tune in on Oct. 20 at 9 AM ET for a live press conference with the IMF’s Director of the European department, Alfred Kammer, to find out: https://t.co/ZVfyjcJdkS
📰 Click here to read the full report, key messages, and press remarks: https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/7IDQa99JBr

What we’re doing: The IMF has provided countries in the region with billions of dollars in Special Drawing Rights and new financing since 2020, and will continue to provide technical support and policy advice to help guide countries towards a full recovery https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/9WOwbMZ8LP

Securing the recovery: Many countries in the region face tough policy decisions as they manage the pandemic. Now is also the time to invest in sustainable, inclusive, and green growth. Here’s how 👇 https://t.co/IGEXPj7pkQ

Where things stand: The recovery will continue into 2022, but expectations for GDP growth over the next few years remain below pre-crisis projections. Small firms and sectors of the economy that require in-person contact have not yet recovered. Unemployment remains high. https://t.co/TspI6XuCDT

What’s new? Vaccine rollouts and the recovery are progressing. But risks are on the rise, and new challenges have emerged: inflation, low employment, less room in the budget for government spending, rising inequality, and increasing uncertainty about the pandemic’s trajectory. https://t.co/ej78pZ0pQm

🧵NEW: The IMF’s latest Regional Economic Outlook for the #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica, Caucasus, and Central Asia.

Here's a quick thread with everything you need to know: what’s new, what the IMF is keeping its eye on, and what countries in the region should focus on: https://t.co/GxI0AAoqJ0
🔴 HAPPENING NOW: Jihad Azour discusses the IMF’s latest economic outlook for the MENA region, Caucasus, and Central Asia in a live press conference. https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/PygyNd5j00

Starting soon at 6 AM ET (12 PM Cairo / 2 PM GST): Jihad Azour discusses the IMF’s latest economic outlook for the #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica, Caucasus, and Central Asia in a live press conference. #MENA

https://t.co/1Qwtg2avql https://t.co/PygyNd5j00

While India’s economic recovery is underway, the economy is likely to require continued support with continued fiscal, monetary, and financial policies to help strengthen the recovery. More in our annual review of the country’s economy https://t.co/Ua3JnDtrug https://t.co/KklRnArOfu

Join us LIVE on Tuesday, October 19 at 8:00 AM ET for a press conference with the IMF’s Changyong Rhee on our latest analysis of the Asia-Pacific Economy: https://t.co/FkepWlp2ug #IMFmeetings #AsiaPacific https://t.co/SrHzg3VGxr
Learn about digital infrastructure known as the India Stack – in a new #FandD online exclusive: https://t.co/2Aim14SheO https://t.co/CXCbxu5Ezx

.@KGeorgieva: Interoperability and regulation are two things to consider when it comes to the impact of #cryptoassets on the international monetary system. 📺 Watch the #DigitalMoney Revolution seminar here: https://t.co/4GgWv5n88l https://t.co/WldJ0stO0P

How can policymakers support #fintech to enable financial inclusion? Join @KGeorgieva and @BIS_org’s Agustín Carstens at the #DCFintechWeek2021, tomorrow, October 19, at 8:15 AM ET. https://t.co/xx3s25TUf4 https://t.co/2ITo5TuofF

In its annual review of the Indian economy, the IMF projects growth of 9.5% this fiscal year, highlighting India’s contribution to global growth and its role as a major producer of COVID-19 vaccines. Read more here: https://t.co/Ua3JnDtrug https://t.co/3gdk2gRQpQ

Of the over 60 countries in the IMF’s Global House Price Index, three-quarters saw increases in house prices during 2020. This trend continues in countries with more recent data. Click the link for the full list of countries: https://t.co/BcdcRZlSc8 https://t.co/88Xoacf8ms

STREAMING NOW: IMF's @GitaGopinath and @Ruchir_Agar present data to explore how countries can exit the pandemic and support a broad-based economic recovery, in a conversation moderated by ABC's @eschulze. https://t.co/Knivhlbr4F #DataForAction https://t.co/yiiZyBDDsB
Join us on Oct. 20 at 9:00 AM ET for a live discussion on the state of the recovery in Europe with the IMF’s Alfred Kammer. https://t.co/BBgmmaVYXq https://t.co/m0iBt9b66e

The pandemic has aggravated food security in sub-Saharan Africa. Join IMF’s Sayeh, @WFPChief, @TahirHamidN & Musa Kpaka to discuss #foodsecurity and an inclusive and green economic recovery in sub-Saharan Africa. https://t.co/SVgZwh1Fjx

🗓 Oct 19, at 7:00 AM ET. https://t.co/2ZgfHNUVml

Global GDP could be reduced by a cumulative $5.3 trillion over the next 5 years if the impact of the pandemic prolongs.

@GitaGopinath writes that we need to step up efforts to ensure #vaccinequity for every country and overcome vaccine hesitancy. https://t.co/oIzPyG8yYI #IMFBlog https://t.co/Ey7ijxD1s5

Are you an economics PhD student in the job market or a recent graduate looking to apply your macroeconomics studies and research to policy work that impacts the global economy? Apply now for our flagship #EconomistProgram. https://t.co/bt8tsLXpuj https://t.co/q9YEM6zdn9

Prices for essential items from food to fuel are rising, but the IMF projects the price pressures to ease next year, amidst great uncertainty. Our latest #WEO research on inflation here: https://t.co/KnxQBjiK2u https://t.co/suTqjHhcqW

REPLAY: Reshma Saujani @reshmasaujani and IMF’s Sabina Bhatia @bhatiasi discuss what needs to be done to help women in developing countries get back to work. #IMFInspired https://t.co/XEUAWmwQou https://t.co/DROu0gT7uy
As we conclude our October 2021 Annual Meetings, let's look back at some of the highlights. #IMFmeetings https://t.co/Rl7y7Ign7Y https://t.co/jZzbJBKBiV

Streaming tomorrow, Monday, Oct 18, at 11:00 AM ET: IMF's @GitaGopinath and @Ruchir_Agar present data to explore how countries can exit the pandemic and support a broad-based economic recovery, in a conversation moderated by ABC's @eschulze. https://t.co/KnivhkTPG5 #DataForAction https://t.co/qRse3H7ovy

Headline inflation in advanced economy group is forecast to peak in the coming months, declining to 2% on average in 2022, amidst economic uncertainty. 
More in our latest #WEO: https://t.co/KnxQBjiK2u https://t.co/gL21xy1cic

.@Kgeorgieva: We need to work together to turn available vaccines into shots in people’s arms. If large parts of the world remain unvaccinated and COVID is with us for much longer, we could see global GDP losses rise to $5.3 trillion over the next 5 years. https://t.co/Q60xtARA1P https://t.co/ojgaAPXB71

The ‘great vaccine divide’ & large disparities in policy support are driving divergences between countries. While almost 60% of the population in advanced economies are fully vaccinated, about 96% in low-income countries remain unvaccinated. https://t.co/oIzPyG8yYI #WEO #IMFBlog https://t.co/X2w9oaVLeC

We forecast growth for emerging market and developing economies at 6.4% in 2021, a marginal revision from our July forecast. 

Growth will moderate to 5.1% in 2022. 

Read the latest World Economic Outlook to learn more: https://t.co/hYpP2Ag5d6 #WEO https://t.co/A2dojbgs3k
The #IMFmeetings are officially over. Find out what happened in our recap. https://t.co/Rl7y7HYMgq https://t.co/QaXTHn3HWB

ICYMI: Marshall Plan For Moms founder Reshma Saujani @reshmasaujani and IMF’s Sabina Bhatia @bhatiasi discuss how to build a better, more flexible workplace in the future. #IMFInspired  https://t.co/XEUAWmwQou https://t.co/SC8RWL4KOJ

“The recovery remains hobbled by the pandemic. We see more uncertainty and three challenges (i) divergence becoming persistent, (ii) inflation requiring more focus of policymakers, and (iii) debt levels going up.” @Kgeorgieva.
